title: Samsara Announces 2025 Impact Report: "Building a Safer, More Sustainable World" - 16.10.2025
text:
Samsara Inc. ("Samsara") (NYSE: IOT), the pioneer of the Connected Operations Platform, is at the forefront of building a safer, more sustainable world alongside its customers. The company’s newly released 2025 Impact Report highlights how its AI-powered platform empowers organizations in the world of physical operations to significantly improve their safety, efficiency, and sustainability. The report also outlines Samsara’s own progress and practices as it builds for the long term.
"Our AI-powered platform helps create safer, more efficient operations for our customers’ frontline workers and their communities," said Sanjit Biswas, CEO and co-founder at Samsara. "We've been innovating quickly, and it's exciting to see how the many new products we've introduced since our last report are already driving real results for our customers. Whether it's helping drivers get home safely or saving organizations millions in fuel costs, the impact is transformative."
Highlights from Samsara’s 2025 Impact Report include:
Creating a Safer Frontline Workforce : Samsara is leading the way in building advanced technology that helps keep frontline workers safe on the job. In FY25, its technology helped customers prevent more than 250,000 accidents, ensuring the people who power our economy can get home safely. Samsara’s new AI tools, including Weather Intelligence and Automated Coaching, empower operations teams to proactively reduce risk, reward top performers, and coach drivers at scale. The company also introduced the Samsara Wearable, enabling quick response and protection outside of the cab to protect frontline workers in any environment. Reducing Fuel, Time, and Paper Waste : Samsara’s platform enables many customers to operate more efficiently and sustainably than ever before. In FY25, Samsara helped customers reduce more than 3 billion pounds of CO2 emissions and digitize over 300 million workflows. Recent innovations like Route Planning and Commercial Navigation provide advanced routing functions that find the most efficient path based on various factors like customer locations, delivery windows, driver availability, vehicle types, and real-world constraints. Additionally, capabilities like Fault Code Intelligence and Automated Work Orders are driving new levels of maintenance and time efficiency. Achieving Net-Zero Emissions by 2040 : Samsara continues to build a sustainable hardware supply chain, invest in climate innovation, and implement efficiencies across the business as it progresses toward its net-zero goal. In FY25, the company achieved an estimated 13% reduction in carbon emissions revenue intensity, incorporated 50% recycled content into its Vehicle Gateways, and expanded supplier sustainability programs. Fostering a Culture of Global Impact : Samsara is committed to building an inclusive culture that reflects the diversity of its customers and empowers every employee. Participation in its employee resource groups grew by 38%, with over 2,000 employees engaged worldwide. Employees gave back with more than 1,500 volunteer hours, and the company’s technology contributions to nonprofits helped extend its mission into local communities. To read Samsara’s 2025 Impact Report, visit here .
About Samsara
Samsara (NYSE: IOT) is the pioneer of the Connected Operations Platform, which is an open platform that connects the people, devices, and systems of some of the world’s most complex operations, allowing them to develop actionable insights and improve their operations. With tens of thousands of customers across North America and Europe, Samsara is a proud technology partner to the people who keep our global economy running, including the world’s leading organizations across industries in transportation, construction, wholesale and retail trade, field services, logistics, manufacturing, utilities and energy, government, healthcare and education, food and beverage, and others. The company's mission is to increase the safety, efficiency, and sustainability of the operations that power the global economy.
